measured_by: frequency of participant-generated responses in an open listing task
justification: "A general sense of what comes to mind across participants in each of the 7 categories can be described in terms of the frequencies of the resulting responses."
construct: Likelihood of a category member coming to mind

measured_by: 1â€“5 Likert rating of how well a feature statement describes the category member
justification: "Participants ... were asked to rate how well statements of the general form 'This [category member] [has this feature]' described the category member on a scale from 1 ('not well') to 5 ('very well')."
construct: Feature applicability (location on a feature dimension)

measured_by: typicality rating scale using statements such as 'It is typical of [category]'
justification: "Feature statements for typicality ... were formed analogously; for the category of zoo animals you would take with you on a plane, these feature statements were 'It is typical of zoo animals you would take with you on a plane.'"

measured_by: goodness rating scale using statements such as 'It is a good [category member]'
justification: "Feature statements for ... goodness were formed analogously; ... the feature statement was 'It is a good zoo animal to take with you on a plane,' respectively."

measured_by: ease-of-response metric (sum of reciprocals of response times during 30-second listing)
justification: "We quantified the 'ease of response' for a single trial by calculating the sum of the reciprocals of the amount of time it took the participant to generate each response ... We take the ease of response to a feature to track the extent to which that feature is relevant to participants' encodings of category members."
